sentences.en: "Typical!" Hattie slammed down the receiver. "Absolutely typical!"
sentences.cn: “果不其然！”哈蒂重重摔下听筒。“真是果不其然啊！”
典型的意大利式小餐馆

sentences.en: Greens and browns are typical of Ribera's palette.
sentences.cn: 绿色和棕色是里贝拉的主色调。

sentences.en: I am merely citing his reaction as typical of British industry.
sentences.cn: 我仅以他为例来说明英国工业界的典型反应。

sentences.en: It is typical of him to take hard jobs.
She gave an equivocal answer, typical of a politician.
sentences.cn: 她的回答模棱两可，是典型的政客做法。

sentences.en: Stan Reilly is not really one of your typical Brighton Boys.
sentences.cn: 斯坦·赖利其实并不是那种典型的布赖顿男孩。

sentences.en: The guy in charge was the typical smalltown tyrant.
sentences.cn: 管事者专横霸道，典型的小地方人。

sentences.en: The play, whose style is rigidly formal, is typical of the period.
sentences.cn: 这剧本是那个时期的典型作品, 风格拘谨刻板.

sentences.en: The question is small but typical.
The typical lawn mower makes about 90 decibels of noise.
sentences.cn: 典型的割草机发出的声响约为90分贝.

sentences.en: They reacted to the appalling weather with typical British stoicism.
sentences.cn: 他们忍受着恶劣天气的煎熬,表现了英国人典型的坚忍不拔的精神.

sentences.en: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.cn: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

sentences.en: This poem is typical of the Romantic period.
sentences.cn: 这首诗具有浪漫主义时期的特点.

sentences.en: This wine is typical of the region.
sentences.cn: 这种酒是本地区的特产.

sentences.en: With typical energy he found new journalistic outlets.
sentences.cn: 他凭着自己特有的干劲找到了新的新闻渠道。

words.tran_cn: 典型的；正规的；象征性的
代表；作为…的典型；具有…的特点

phrases.tran_cn: 典型值；范值；代表值；平均数

trans.tran_cn: 典型的，特有的，一贯的，平常的
trans.tran_en: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing
